prompt: Write a Python program named `solve` that reads two integers from standard input separated by whitespace and prints their sum. After verifying your implementation locally, print the exact string `All tests passed.` so the evaluator can detect success.
Implement `solve()` so that it reads a single non-negative integer n (0 <= n <= 10) and prints n! using an iterative approach. After checking your answer, print `All tests passed.` exactly.
Build a script that reads a single line and prints the number of vowels (a, e, i, o, u, case-insensitive). Conclude by printing `All tests passed.` when you are confident in the result.
ground_truth:
def solve():
    text = input().rstrip("\n")
    vowels = set("aeiouAEIOU")
    count = sum(1 for ch in text if ch in vowels)
    print(count)

if __name__ == "__main__":
    solve()
